humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides the size of the tumor as 2.0 x 2.0 x 2.0 cm. According to the rules, T2 tumors are more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm. Therefore, the pathologic T stage of the patient's cancer is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage for cancer is determined by the size of the tumor. In this report, the tumor size is described as 2x2x2 cm. The T stage for a tumor of this size is T2. This is supported by the histopathological diagnosis which also gives a T stage of T2 (pT2).
